meanings.definition: To make or become more intense or stronger.
meanings.sent1: She was intensifying her workout routine to get stronger.
meanings.sent2: The storm was intensifying as the winds picked up speed.
meanings.sent3: The chef kept intensifying the flavors in the soup until it was too spicy for anyone to eat.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was intensifying, making it hard to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The music gradually intensifying, reaching a crescendo that filled the hall.

meanings.definition: To increase in degree or strength.
meanings.sent1: His efforts in studying were intensifying as the exam date approached.
meanings.sent2: The competition was intensifying as more skilled players joined.
meanings.sent3: The argument was intensifying, with each side trying to outshout the other.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset were intensifying, painting the sky in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread intensifying, drawing people into the bakery.
